snippet: Rafael Diaz faced charges after storming onto Citi Field to celebrate after the Mets pitcher Johan Santana threw the first no-hitter in the team’s 51-season history.
abstract: New York Mets fan Rafael Diaz faces charges of interfering with a sporting event and criminal trespass after he stormed onto Citi Field to celebrate pitcher Johan Santana's no-hitter, the first in the team's 51-season history, joining the players' scrum as if he belonged to the team.

byline.contributor: Zach Berman and Andrew Keh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Rafael Diaz faced charges after storming onto Citi Field to celebrate after the Mets pitcher Johan Santana threw the first no-hitter in the team’s 51-season history.

headline.seo: Rafael Diaz, Die-Hard Mets Fan, Is Charged After Celebrating No-Hitter on Field
headline.main: For Mets Fan, First a Field Trip, Then the Charges
headline.print_headline: For Mets Fan, First a Field Trip, Then the Charges
